interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: b.m.c by Bundle Monster 20pc Nail Art Image Manicure Stamping Plates-CYO 2 Collection Review Date: 2015/08/22 Store: HealthMarket Product Description: ['Bundle Monster 20pc Nail Art Image Manicure Stamping Plates-2014 CYO Collection'] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Product Dimensions': '2.2 x 2.2 x 0.1 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'UPC': '701233192271', 'Manufacturer': 'HealthMarket'} Review Text: These are the stamping plates that I use all the time. I stamp over gel nail polish with konad stamping polish, Essie polish, or Sallie Hanson insta-dri polish. When you first pull off the blue protective film, clean the plates really well with acetone. Then, I usually paint, scrape, roll, and then clean everything off without actually rolling the first stamping on my nails. I find the first stamping doesn't go well on a fresh plate, so I just don't waste my time.
After doing that, they stamp fine all the time. I have found at least one image in every stamper bundle that has stamping issues. I just don't use that stamp. These plates have intricate designs that transfer well. If you find that not all of your design is trasferring, first clean the plate really well with acetone. All that built-up dried polish affects the stamp. There are lots of good videos on stamping troubleshooting, too, if you are having trouble.
I stamp with a konad stamper, and scrape with an old credit card or empty gift cards. Metal scrapers will damage the plates. Review Title: My go-to stampers Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Maniology (formerly bmc) Peel-able Temporary Short Wear Swatching Nail Lacquer Gel Polish Base Coat b.m.c {'Brand': 'B.m.c', 'Item Form': 'Gel', 'Type': 'Gel', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '1.1 x 1.1 x 2.6 inches', 'Item Weight': '0.05 Pounds', 'Product Dimensions': '1.1 x 1.1 x 2.6 inches; 0.8 Ounces', 'UPC': '708302916301'} Read reviews and thought this would be great. Not so for me. Clean release on some of my nail, and damaged the crap out of the lower 2/3. They looked like I had pried off acrylics. I nearly cried. I took a fine file to them, and the damage wasn't quite so bad, except for one nail. My left thumb was badly damaged. It took weeks to grow out the damage.
This, however, works ok with my teenagers nails, as she likes to peel off her nails if she gets bored (eeek) and this actually keeps her nails from being damaged. So, for her nails, its a 5, for mine, it was a 1, so I rated it thusly. Not impressed for me, works on others PUEEN 168 Nail Stamping Plates Synthetic Leather Holder Case Organizer in Blue Rose Lace Pattern-BH000006 PUEEN {} Use this with my bmc and other plates. I haven't had any issues with it. The front feels nice, I like the texture. Zipper works smooth. No obvious defects, sewing issues, etc. No nauseating smells when I got it. Plastic has a smooth feel to it that I like, doesn't feel cheap. Holds plates pretty well. Turn it upside down and shake it, yeah, you get some slipping. I haven't had any slide out, and I've accidentally carried it around upside down quite a lot, dropped it and in one stunning display of clumsiness - I managed to drop it, then kick it across the room, picked it up only to drop it from chest high. Sigh. And all the plates were STILL in place, and this thing is holding up quite well. Really happy with it. Recommend! I love it, works great with my plates b.m.c by Bundle Monster 20pc Nail Art Image Manicure Stamping Plates-CYO 2 Collection HealthMarket ['Bundle Monster 20pc Nail Art Image Manicure Stamping Plates-2014 CYO Collection'] {'Product Dimensions': '2.2 x 2.2 x 0.1 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'UPC': '701233192271', 'Manufacturer': 'HealthMarket'} These are the stamping plates that I use all the time. I stamp over gel nail polish with konad stamping polish, Essie polish, or Sallie Hanson insta-dri polish. When you first pull off the blue protective film, clean the plates really well with acetone. Then, I usually paint, scrape, roll, and then clean everything off without actually rolling the first stamping on my nails. I find the first stamping doesn't go well on a fresh plate, so I just don't waste my time.
After doing that, they stamp fine all the time. I have found at least one image in every stamper bundle that has stamping issues. I just don't use that stamp. These plates have intricate designs that transfer well. If you find that not all of your design is trasferring, first clean the plate really well with acetone. All that built-up dried polish affects the stamp. There are lots of good videos on stamping troubleshooting, too, if you are having trouble.
I stamp with a konad stamper, and scrape with an old credit card or empty gift cards. Metal scrapers will damage the plates. My go-to stampers
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Product Type Preference:** The user has a strong ongoing interest in nail care products, particularly those that facilitate easy application and removal. Their recent purchase highlights a further embrace of creative accessories, specifically tools for nail art applications and stamping.
  
- **Experience Variability:** Their experiences with nail art products are nuanced, demonstrating both personal and communal usability. The user continues to prioritize reliability and consistency in product performance.

- **Sensitivity to Damage:** The user remains vigilant about nail health, focusing on products that minimize the risk of damage to their nails. Their approach reflects a commitment to safety and ongoing nail care throughout their beauty routine.

- **Family Usage Consideration:** The user actively evaluates products not only for personal use but also for their family, particularly their teenagers. This consideration shapes their assessment of usability and effectiveness across different age groups.

- **Balanced Rating System:** They utilize a dual-rating system to assess products, reflecting a thoughtful and analytical approach to product performance based on their and their family's experiences.

- **Rating Influence:** Their satisfaction with products is closely tied to both individual effectiveness and overall functionality, signifying a careful balance between personal preferences and broader usability observations.

Overall, the user exhibits a discerning adaptability towards beauty-related products, valuing safety, functionality, and family usability, particularly in the realm of nail care and art.
